intro: Allium kopetdagense, commonly known as the Kopetdag garlic, is a bulbous plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and spherical bulbs. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in a spherical inflorescence. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
